scripts.say: Sweet, finally! Time to go home!
Saratoga, what's the matter? You've looked deep in thought for some time now.
Oh, it's nothing! I was just thinking about what a long and exhausting operation this was!
Right? It's nothing short of a miracle that we managed to keep everyone safe through all that!
Of course we're okay! We're allies of justice after all!
But if what they said is true - that the attack on NY City was just a ploy to lure us into the Bermuda Triangle - then what were the Sirens trying to achieve...?
Even up until the singularity disappeared, Tester didn't even show her face. I'm concerned about what she's brewing up next...
Until the Sirens have unconditionally surrendered, I'm sure we'll clash with her again.
We'll have plenty of opportunities to slowly settle the score in the future.
I would say that our discovery - that we can disrupt a singularity from forming - is a great leap forward for our knowledge.
Hopefully, this will help progress our understand of the singularity's mechanisms and lead to the development of a safe method of eliminating them.
Commander, I heard you came across a Hornet impostor as well?
How underhanded. They clearly were targeting Enterprise with a move like that!
After fighting the Sirens more, I think I'm starting to understand why they make these clones.
We didn't have any problems dealing with the clones, but it's clear that they strive to confuse and demoralize us by forcing us to aim at the likeness of our own comrades.
(But Enterprise wouldn't fall for such cheap tricks! I wish I was more like her...))
That reminds me... Before we sortied, we ran into Memphis. She looked quite gloomy, grumbling things like, "heh heh heh, let's hope you have a pleasant voyage" to herself...
We did, too. She's been working extremely hard behind the scenes for us. I heard she went above and beyond by contacting headquarters, planning the operation, and writing documents.
S-so that's the reason why she seemed like a whole other person when we saw her...
Well, the operation went off without a hitch, so I think we should go on a vacation somewhere~ How about you guys?
I'll go with you. Wherever you're heading, I will follow.
Hmm... If I get the time, I think I'd like to go someplace far away... Perhaps like the valley I was named after.
Where would you go, Enterprise?
I... don't really know. Even if the war was over...
Commander... have you thought about what you'll do once this war is over?
